intro: Bupleurum gerardi var. austriacum, commonly known as Austrian boldo, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its roots are often harvested for their medicinal properties, containing compounds used in traditional remedies. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
